intro: Boopis agglomerata, commonly known as the clustered boopis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as reduced leaf surface area to minimize water loss. Its flowering period occurs in the spring and early summer, producing small yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators like bees and butterflies. Boopis agglomerata is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
